newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian shares slip, seen vulnerable.
newsitem.headline: Austrian shares slip, seen vulnerable.

text.p: Austrian shares slipped 1.15 percent on Monday, knocked lower by a weak internatinal environment, and traders said a bearish tone may prevail over the next few days.
"People have been unnerved by the currency markets and there will be no let-up in volatility as long as there is speculation about the start date for a single European currency," one trader said.
Others noted the expiry of March futures and options on Friday was doing little to calm investor nerves.
"We are entering a turbulent phase," said another dealer.
The ATX index of blue-chip shares ended 14.26 points down at 1,223.75 with 19 issues lower and just two higher.
Semi-conductor maker AMS was the biggest decliner but dealers reported downward pressure right across the board. AMS finished 4.71 percent down at 1,110.10 schillings.
Hosiery maker Wolford was the leading gainer, up 1.07 percent at 1,420 schillings.
March ATX future closed 20.3 points down at 1,220.1. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 531 12257
